column4: Hi all, I need to run /etc/init.d/postgresql-8.3 start, as user postgres, at system startup. How should I do that?
if you got to System/Administration/Services you can enable or disable postgresql at startup
a gui way to do that, this I have to see, brb
durt: figures: there's a reason postgres is unchecked, maybe it's not being started as user postgres, because it did not start up. Is there a log I can check for an error message?
